author: Sefy Levy
description: Distinguish MORB, OIB, arc basalts, and crustal contamination using mantle array diagrams

classifications.name: PLUME/OIB AFFINITY (Nb/Yb > 10)
classifications.description: Ocean Island Basalt or plume-like source signature

rules.comment: High Nb/Yb indicates enriched mantle source

classifications.notes: Enriched mantle source - typical of intraplate volcanism

classifications.name: CRUSTAL CONTAMINATION (High Th/Yb)
classifications.description: Elevated Th/Yb indicates crustal contamination or arc influence
classifications.notes: Displacement above mantle array line - crustal assimilation or subduction component

classifications.name: DEPLETED MORB-LIKE
classifications.description: Depleted mantle signature typical of mid-ocean ridges
classifications.notes: Depleted mantle source - extensional tectonic setting

classifications.name: ENRICHED MORB / TRANSITIONAL
classifications.description: Enriched MORB or transitional between MORB and OIB
classifications.notes: Transitional between depleted and enriched mantle sources

classifications.name: INSUFFICIENT DATA
classifications.notes: Requires Nb, Yb, and Th measurements

notes: Nb/Yb vs Th/Yb plots in log space. High Nb/Yb indicates enriched (plume) source. Displacement above mantle array indicates crustal contamination. Full interpretation requires plotting both ratios together.
